alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 2:02PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Worcester and northern Accomack Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 202 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northeast of Parksley, or 14 miles southeast of Pocomoke City, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pocomoke City, Berlin, Snow Hill, Newark, Hallwood, Horntown, Mappsville, Ocean City Municipality, Goodwill, Greenbackville, Wallops Island, Temperanceville, Oak Hall, Cedartown, Mount Wesley, Assawoman, Beaver Dam, Whiton, Boxiron and Public Landing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southeastern Maryland...and southeastern Virginia.
